result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

9:08 AM Defendant Casey Merlin Zillmer appeared by video, in custody from JCJ. Special prosecutor Lynne Van Hollen appearing specially. SPD Sebion appears with qualify status update. . AIA set for 10/21 @ 1 pm.

Until further order of the court, you shall have no contact, directly or indirectly, either personally, by mail, telephone or through any other person, except through your attorney, with any of the following individuals:  Co-defendant, Victim 1, 2 and 3.  No contact with other minor biological children.  Minor children under the age of 18.

11:45 AM Defendant Casey Merlin Zillmer appears by video in the custody of JCJ, without counsel.  Attorney Lynne Van Hollen appeared via video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant agrees to appear remotely and to proceed without the complaint in hand. Court advised the defendant of the charges and possible penalties.  He understood.  Court explained his attorney rights. He will contact SPD.  State recommends a $10,000 cash bond with no contact with the co-defendant, victims or the other biological minor children, minors under the age of 18.  Court sets bond.  Prosecution is to draft a no contact order 940.47. AIA set for 10/17 at 9 am.

Initial appearance on October 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
